newsitem.title: UK: Yahoo! Europe users mainly affluent men.
newsitem.headline: Yahoo! Europe users mainly affluent men.

text.p: Yahoo! Europe, a provider of Internet search engines, said on Thursday that a new survey showed its average user is an affluent, professional man, aged 25 to 44.

Yahoo! Europe, a joint venture of U.S.-based Yahoo Inc and Softbank Holdings Ltd, a unit of Japan's Softbank Corp, said the survey of 12,394 Yahoo! users in Britain, France and Germany showed users have an average household income of $56,300.

"The European Yahoo! user is an affluent, home-owning professional with a family life who uses the Internet to improve his or her busy lifestyle," Heather Killen, managing director of European operations, said in a statement.

The average income of Yahoo! users in Britain is 44,000 pounds ($71,800), 96,807 marks ($52,700) in Germany and 274,000 francs ($44,300) in France. In the UK, 85 percent of users are men, with 59 percent aged 25 to 44; 91 percent of both German and French users are men, with 63 percent of German users aged 25 to 44 and 58 percent of French users aged 25 to 44, Yahoo! said.
-- London Advertising Newsdesk +44 171 542 2815 ($ = 0.612 British Pounds) ($ = 6.184 French Francs) ($ = 1.835 German Marks)
